stories.text: Just curious. I live in Maui and it's very interesting to see how the world is changing from old business models to new ones. I am glad business-as-usual is being disrupted, but I can see how some of the newer companies are sometimes just as bad or sometimes worse.
stories.title: Ask HN: How has Airbnb changed the housing market where you live? Tourism?

stories.text: Just saw this thread of a couple of months ago, so my apologies for returning to it so late. As it happens, my grandfather, Thomas Zielinski, owned the Scottish Cafe (Brettschneider was the manager). I recently wrote a couple of papers that answer many of the questions raised in the discussion - the full text of the English "Mathematicians at the Scottish Cafe" is here: https://www.researchgate.net/publication/335742570_Mathematicians_at_the_Scottish_Cafe). I am currently embarking on a play loosely around this topic.
stories.title: Scottish Cafe

stories.text: The data volume is growing and we have better machine learning algorithms to handle it. What do you think are the best companies in the field that I can choose instead of going to FAANG? How can you get there without knowing anyone, do you know about conferences/events for this field similar to tech talks or NeurIPS?
stories.title: Ask HN: What are the best companies to apply AI in biology/medicine?
